verses.verse: The Folly of Trust in Riches To the leader. Of the Korahites. A Psalm. (Ps 33.8; 78.1) Hear this, all you peoples; give ear, all inhabitants of the world,
both low and high, rich and poor together.
(Ps 37.30; 119.130) My mouth shall speak wisdom; the meditation of my heart shall be understanding.
(Num 12.8; Ps 78.2) I will incline my ear to a proverb; I will solve my riddle to the music of the harp.
(Ps 23.4) Why should I fear in times of trouble, when the iniquity of my persecutors surrounds me,
(Job 31.24) those who trust in their wealth and boast of the abundance of their riches?
(Job 36.18; Mt 25.8, 9) Truly, no ransom avails for one’s life; (Or no one can ransom a brother) there is no price one can give to God for it.
(Mt 16.26) For the ransom of life is costly and can never suffice,
(Ps 22.29; 89.48) that one should live on forever and never see the Pit.
(Eccl 2.16, 18) When we look at the wise, they die; fool and dolt perish together and leave their wealth to others.
(Deut 3.14; Ps 10.6; 64.6) Their graves (Gk Syr Compare Tg: Heb their inward thought) are their homes forever, their dwelling places to all generations, though they named lands their own.
(v 20) Mortals cannot abide in their pomp; they are like the animals that perish.
(Lk 12.20) Such is the fate of the foolhardy, the end of those (Tg: Heb after them) who are pleased with their lot. Selah

(Job 24.19; Ps 9.17; Dan 7.18; 1 Cor 6.2) Like sheep they are appointed for Sheol; Death shall be their shepherd; straight to the grave they descend, (Cn: Heb the upright shall have dominion over them in the morning) and their form shall waste away; Sheol shall be their home. (Meaning of Heb uncertain)
(Ps 56.13; 73.24) But God will ransom my soul from the power of Sheol, for he will receive me. Selah
(Ps 37.7) Do not be afraid when some become rich, when the wealth of their houses increases.
(Ps 17.14) For when they die they will carry nothing away; their wealth will not go down after them.
(Lk 12.19) Though in their lifetime they count themselves happy —for you are praised when you do well for yourself—
(Gen 15.15; Job 33.30) they (Cn: Heb you) will go to the company of their ancestors, who will never again see the light.
(v 12) Mortals cannot abide in their pomp; they are like the animals that perish.
